Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: 2D (4,4) coordination layer stacking to form 1D channels

Other Information.Additional Info: Guest molecules accommodated in 1D channels, later removed to form porous material.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Molecular sieving/size exclusion; unable to diffuse into channels freely.

Other Information.Additional Info: Very small quantity adsorbed, only surface adsorption.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving based on pore apertures being too small for N2 diffusion, but allowing accommodation of solvent molecules (DMF) during synthesis.

Experimental Validation.Method: Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA), X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD), Nitrogen adsorption isotherms
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Weight loss of lattice DMF: 23.85% (calcd: 24.20%), BET surface area: 5.19 m2/g, Microporous volume: 1.103 × 10-3 cm3/g, Gas adsorbed N2: 22.8 mL/g at 1 atm.

Other Information.Additional Info: Porous host framework retained after guest exclusion. Structure stabilized by host-guest O-H…O hydrogen bonds and intralayer O-H…S interactions. Desolvated solid conforms to XRPD pattern of intact material.
Guest molecules accommodated in 1D channels, later removed to form porous material. Occupies 33% (708 Å3) of unit-cell volume.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Molecular sieving/size exclusion; unable to diffuse into channels freely.

Other Information.Additional Info: Very small quantity adsorbed, only surface adsorption.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving based on pore apertures being too small for N2 diffusion, but allowing accommodation of solvent molecules (CHCl3) during synthesis.

Experimental Validation.Method: Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA), X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD), Nitrogen adsorption isotherms
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Weight loss of lattice chloroform: 19.59% (calcd: 20.30%), BET surface area: 3.25 m2/g, Microporous volume: 1.163 × 10-3 cm3/g, Gas adsorbed N2: 8.6 mL/g at 1 atm.

Other Information.Additional Info: Porous host framework retained after guest exclusion. Potentially stabilized by weak C-H…S interactions. Desolvated solid conforms to XRPD pattern of intact material.
